description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

The Sales Data and Operations team is looking for an intellectually curious data compliance analyst with a background in data governance and compliance, audit processes and excellent project management skills.

As a Data Governance Analyst, you will drive the vision, priorities and plans for the data governance program. You will help translate security and legal requirements for the sales teams, improve auditing mechanisms and validate internal control effectiveness to strengthen compliance. You will need to build effective relationships cross-functionally to reach our data governance objectives through creative problem-solving and thinking at scale. Additionally, you will bring your analytical capabilities to drive business recommendations and support global strategic and tactical initiatives on data compliance, with an emphasis on tools.

In this role, you will develop data-driven insights, opinions and qualitative recommendations to drive the business forward in a measurable way. You are a self-starter who can work in a rapidly changing environment and tolerate ambiguity, demonstrating problem-solving leadership with limited supervision.

The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience in a data protection oversight and/or consulting.
  • Experience using database scripting languages (e.g., SQL, Hive, MySQL).
  • Experience in operations and process improvement.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge about business and technology issues related to management of enterprise information assets.
  • Knowledge about different approaches related to data protection.
  • Knowledge about data governance best practices.
  • Ability to identify, quantify and effectively address business risks associated with data quality or non-compliance.
  • Excellent analytical skills.
responsibilities:
• Help define the data management vision and implement data management strategies and processes.
  • Leverage data and analytics to identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations and influence strategy on compliance. Assist the sales teams in maintaining compliance with data privacy/data protection.
  • Perform risk assessments and work with Security and Privacy teams to ensure effective controls over security of data.
  • Understand the sales data landscape, identify where data sets reside and their underlying structure.
  • Identify opportunities and processes to ensure data meets the following characteristics, including but not limited to: accuracy, validity, reliability, timeliness, relevance and completeness.
title: Data Governance Manager
